description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bqkn7","text":"Mixed glial cells were obtained from C57BL/6 mice embryonic day 17. Cells were cultured in high-glucose DMEM/F12 supplemented with 10% FBS in humidified air containing 5% CO2 at 37°C. The culture medium was replaced with fresh medium 24 h after the initial preparation and every 3 days thereafter. After 1 week, microglial cells were obtained by mechanical shaking of the mixed glial cell cultures for 1 h. Cells were routinely monitored for purity by ionized calcium-binding adaptor molecule 1 (Iba1) staining and the population of Iba1+ cells was \u003e95% ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5drtv","text":"Primary microglial culture  - Use C57BL/6J mice at embryonic day 17 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ctn7p","text":"Anesthetized pregnant mice (1% sodium pentobarbital, 80mg/kg), dissect their embryos and collect the cortex. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dm7ov","text":"(Separate and remove the soft membrane and blood vessels, rinse the cerebral cortex in PBS, and use the ophthalmic scissor to cut pieces of the cortex)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
